        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by

        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

    background: var(--chops-white);

    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;

  }

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }

  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {

    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

  :host {

    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    text-decoration: none;

    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required?         This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label.         I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </span>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

        <tbody>
          <tr>
            
            <!---->

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;

        }

          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;

          z-index: 10;

          width: 100%;

          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;

          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }

          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;

        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

            width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

class="line"><!---->  Heap left redzone:       fa<!----></span><br>  Freed heap region:       fd<span class="line"><!---->  Freed heap region:       fd<!----></span><br>  Stack left redzone:      f1<span class="line"><!---->  Stack left redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span class="line"><!---->  Intra object redzone:    bb<!----></span><br>  ASan internal:           fe<span class="line"><!---->  ASan internal:         Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <span class="line"><!---->1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required?         I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

<span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>cf2ba42acf6977eb009c5d93625d343e6dce6eed<a class="undefined" target="_blank" Sonzogni &lt;<!----></span>arthursonzogni@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/arthursonzogni@chromium.org"><!---->arthursonzogni@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Thu Jun 23 14:11:33 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Thu Jun 23 14:11:33 2022<!----></span><br><br>Reland "Unify/Correct ProfileDestroyer implementation."<span class="line"><!---->Reland "Unify/Correct ProfileDestroyer implementation."<!----></span><br><br>It got reverted in:<span class="line"><!---->It got reverted in:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3714253<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3714253"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3714253<!----></a><br><br>The problem was that an OTR profile destruction is requested from two<span class="line"><!---->The problem was that an OTR profile destruction is requested from two<!----></span><br>locations:<span class="line"><!---->locations:<!----></span><br>-PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->-PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager()<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager()<!----></span><br><br>To solve this, we follow @nicolaso advice:<span class="line"><!---->To solve this, we follow @nicolaso advice:<!----></span><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1337388#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1337388#c12"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1337388#c12<!----></a><br><br>We allow two requests to destroy the same profile. The first request<span class="line"><!---->We allow two requests to destroy the same profile. The first request<!----></span><br>is canceled and replaced by the new one.<span class="line"><!---->is canceled and replaced by the new one.<!----></span><br><br>See the diff in between patchset 1 and N for what has been added in the reland:<span class="line"><!---->See the diff in between patchset 1 and N for what has been added in the reland:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3714294/1..2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3714294/1..2"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3714294/1..2<!----></a><br><br>> Unify/Correct ProfileDestroyer implementation.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Unify/Correct ProfileDestroyer implementation.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> This patch is a dependency of:<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This patch is a dependency of:<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3620393/1<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3620393/1"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3620393/1<!----></a><br>> were WebContents destruction are going to be deferred into a new task.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; were WebContents destruction are going to be deferred into a new task.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The ProfileDestroyer currently has several problems:<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The ProfileDestroyer currently has several problems:<!----></span><br>> 1. Depending on whether the profile is an incognito one or not,<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 1. Depending on whether the profile is an incognito one or not,<!----></span><br>>    the profile is either destroyed immediately or we wait for the<span class="line"><!---->&gt;    the profile is either destroyed immediately or we wait for the<!----></span><br>>    associated RenderProcessHost to shutdown first.<span class="line"><!---->&gt;    associated RenderProcessHost to shutdown first.<!----></span><br>> 2. The ProfileDestroyer assert there are no remaining RenderProcessHost<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 2. The ProfileDestroyer assert there are no remaining RenderProcessHost<!----></span><br>>    associated with a Profile. However, (1) do not provide this<span class="line"><!---->&gt;    associated with a Profile. However, (1) do not provide this<!----></span><br>>    guarantee for non-incognito profiles.<span class="line"><!---->&gt;    guarantee for non-incognito profiles.<!----></span><br>> 3. The implementation doesn't wait for RenderProcess Shutdown when they<span class="line"><!---->&gt; 3. The implementation doesn't wait for RenderProcess Shutdown when they<!----></span><br>>    have been added in between calling the ProfileDestroyer and<span class="line"><!---->&gt;    have been added in between calling the ProfileDestroyer and<!----></span><br>>    destroying the profile.<span class="line"><!---->&gt;    destroying the profile.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> This patch unify the Incognito/Normal profile destruction. It also make<span class="line"><!---->&gt; This patch unify the Incognito/Normal profile destruction. It also make<!----></span><br>> the ProfileDestroyer to take into account new RenderProcessHost.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; the ProfileDestroyer to take into account new RenderProcessHost.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> Change-Id: Ia28f384502bfd57466fca94a0234e325984139ef<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Change-Id:         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
