      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
              Cancel
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <span class="line"><!---->1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577<!----></a> is the root cause.<span class="line"><!----> is the root cause.<!----></span><br>2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      nicolaso@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->nicolaso@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Not requesting merge to dev (M105) because latest trunk commit (1017147) appears to be prior to dev branch point (1027018). If this is incorrect, please replace the Merge-NA-105 label with Merge-Request-105. If other changes are required to fix this bug completely, please request a merge if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->Not requesting merge to dev (M105) because latest trunk commit (1017147) appears to be prior to dev branch point (1027018). If this is incorrect, please replace the Merge-NA-105 label with Merge-Request-105. If other changes are required to fix this bug completely, please request a merge if necessary.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report.         Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <span class="line"><!---->1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577<!----></a> is the root cause.<span class="line"><!----> is the root cause.<!----></span><br>2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow?         I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      nicolaso@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->nicolaso@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required? AllTabContentses();<!----></span><br>  auto it = std::find(all_tabs.begin(), all_tabs.end(), web_contents);<span class="line"><!---->  auto it = std::find(all_tabs.begin(), all_tabs.end(), web_contents);<!----></span><br><br>  return (it == all_tabs.end()) ? nullptr : it.browser();<span class="line"><!---->  return (it == all_tabs.end()) ? nullptr : it.browser();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/browser_finder.cc;l=230-236?q=browser_finder.cc&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined"         I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 28, 2022, 8:00 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <span class="line"><!---->1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577<!----></a> is the root cause.<span class="line"><!----> is the root cause.<!----></span><br>2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow?         I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      nicolaso@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->nicolaso@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This issue need to install extensions from <span class="line"><!---->This issue need to install extensions from <!----></span>issue #1297404<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1297404" title="Security: heap-use-after-free in global_media_controls::MediaItemManagerImpl::HideItem"><!---->issue #1297404<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> UaF on linux-chromeOS<span class="line"><!----> UaF on linux-chromeOS<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Chromium 105.0.5126.0<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Chromium 105.0.5126.0<!----></span><br>Operating System: linux-chromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: linux-chromeOS<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>enable dual display<span class="line"><!---->enable dual display<!----></span><br>(1) Install extensions<span class="line"><!---->(1) Install extensions<!----></span><br>(2) wait ~5sec  then sign-out with CTRL + Q (2 times). In real devices, after logout, will redirect to login page. <span class="line"><!---->(2) wait ~5sec  then sign-out with CTRL + Q (2 times).         Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report! +arthursonzogni@, can this UaF be introduced in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577?"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577?<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<span class="line"><!---->Setting severity to medium tentatively, because it requires an extension to install and happens during profile destruction. But it's currently not clear whether the extension is required. If not, the severity should be high. Setting OS to ChromeOS for now, but it is possible that this can be reproduced on other platforms if the root cause is related to the lifetime of the profile that is not specific to ChromeOS.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<span class="line"><!---->Reporter, if you can provide the following information, that would be really helpful for us to investigate:<!----></span><br>1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <span class="line"><!---->1) Does this reproduce for versions before 105.0.5113.0? This can help us understand whether <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/3560577<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/3560577"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/3560577<!----></a> is the root cause.<span class="line"><!----> is the root cause.<!----></span><br>2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<span class="line"><!---->2) Is installing the extension required? Can this be reproduced by simply tweaking sign-in/sign-out flow? The root cause seems to be related to profiles construction and destruction, but not directly related to extension APIs.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I added some debug lines.<span class="line"><!---->I added some debug lines.<!----></span><br><br>The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<span class="line"><!---->The OTR profile destruction is requested from both:<!----></span><br>- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<span class="line"><!---->- PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyProfileWhenAppropriated<!----></span><br>- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<span class="line"><!---->- ProfileManager::~ProfileManager() via ProfileDestroyer::DestroyOffTheRecordProfileNow() during shutdown.<!----></span><br><br>So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<span class="line"><!---->So, it looks like the OTR profile lifetime is managed by both the PresentationReceiverWindowController and the ProfileManager without coordination.<!----></span><br><br>nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<span class="line"><!---->nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this? Or the one you would like to see instead.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 12<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

      nicolaso@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->nicolaso@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1337388#c12">Comment 12<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jun 20, 2022, 1:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        > PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<span class="line"><!---->&gt; PresentationReceiverWindowController::~PresentationReceiverWindowController<!----></span><br><br>OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<span class="line"><!---->OK, so this class creates its own unique OTR profile. This is rather atypical, but there are a couple other call-sites like this [1]. Another likely culprit is DevTools, for instance [2].<!----></span><br><br>> nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; nicolaso@ what kind of ownership model is expected for this?<!----></span><br><br>Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<span class="line"><!---->Classes like PresentationReceiverWindowController should preserve the ability to destroy their Profile early, when they know it's unused (like they're doing now via ProfileDestroyer). This is using resources responsibly.<!----></span><br><br>And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<span class="line"><!---->And ~ProfileManager should ensure that any OTR profiles that *haven't* been destroyed yet, are destroyed. The original CL does that well.<!----></span><br><br>IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<span class="line"><!---->IMO it should be OK to call DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() method multiple times on the same profile, as it may not succeed immediately. It's easier to allow multiple "destructions" than to keep track of a profile's state in multiple places. The second call should just be a no-op.<!----></span><br><br>You could replace the set<ProfileDestroyer*> with a map<Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*>. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<span class="line"><!---->You could replace the set&lt;ProfileDestroyer*&gt; with a map&lt;Profile*, ProfileDestroyer*&gt;. That way there's only one PendingDestroyer per profile. Calling DestroyProfileWhenAppropriate() a second time should be a no-op, and calling DestroyProfileNow() should cancel the pending ProfileDestroyer on that profile.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/profiles/profile.h;l=93-105;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/devtools/devtools_browser_context_manager.cc;l=91;drc=169c6cc102b39295a5bfe2f2a176b42b1c2fe2c4<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Not requesting merge to dev (M105) because latest trunk commit (1017147) appears to be prior to dev branch point (1027018).         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided upon due to this issue being highly mitigated by not being remote exploitable, reliant on profile destruction, and the high degree of user interaction required. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza. The VRP Panel has decided to award you $1,000 for this report.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
